intro: Gymnopsis helianthoides, commonly known as the yellow globe-mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its fruit is a spherical capsule that splits open to release seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Gymnopsis helianthoides is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
